articles.title: Talks with Chinese Official Held
articles.content:
Talks with Chinese Official Held 
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Kye Gwan, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, had talks with Zhang Zhijun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of China, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Sunday. 
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Vice-Minister Kim Song Gi and other officials of the Foreign Ministry and from the Chinese side Zhang Zhijun's party, Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai and staff members of the Chinese embassy here. 
					
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on boosting the bilateral friendship and matters of mutual concern.

articles.title: Chinese Official and His Party Arrive
articles.content:
Chinese Official and His Party Arrive
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Zhang Zhijun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of China, and his party arrived here on Sunday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Congratulates President of Zimbabw
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Congratulates President of Zimbabw
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of congratulations to Robert Gabriel Mugabe, President of Zimbabwe, on the occasion of his 87th birthday.
					 Kim in the message wished the president good health in happiness and successes in his work for the peace and stability of the country.

articles.title: Seminar on Circular Stockbreeding and Agriculture Production to Be Held
articles.content:
Seminar on Circular Stockbreeding and Agriculture Production to Be Held 
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- A seminar on the circular production system in stockbreeding and agriculture is to be held in Pyongyang. It will open at the Grand People's Study House on February 22 under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea. 
					 The seminar will hear scientific and technological successes gained in developing stockbreeding and agriculture simultaneously based on ring-shape circular production system as well as experiences. 
					
					 A presentation of science and technology, exhibition of successes and scientific and technological lecture will be also given. 
					
					 Scientists, technicians and officials in the fields of agriculture and biology across the country will take part.

articles.title: Bead Embroidery "Birthplace in Paektusan Secret Camp"
articles.content:
Bead Embroidery "Birthplace in Paektusan Secret Camp"
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- A bead embroidery "Birthplace in  Paektusan Secret Camp" is a gift a south Korean woman sent to General Secretary Kim Jong Il with deep reverence for him.
					 It took seven years for her to gather nearly 100,000 beads and design the gift. Though she was neither an embroiderer nor an experienced hand at craftwork, she trimmed the beads and strung them in different colors and shapes to portray Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the Paektusan secret camp.
					
					 The gift mirrors south Korean people's belief that under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, the DPRK socialist society centered on the masses demonstrates its might and the dignity, honor and pride of the Korean nation and a bright future of the country's reunification are guaranteed.     
					
					 Letters "Jong Il Peak" are seen in the upper part of the peak behind his native home. The letters, decorated with gilded beads, symbolize his deep love for all the Korean people, while the dense forest around the peak represents the whole nation following his Songun (military-first) politics. Two bouquets reflect south Korean people's will to celebrate his birthday every year.
					
					 The gift also shows their ardent desire to live a happy life in the reunified country, holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the sun of the nation.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges Japan to Settle Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges Japan to Settle Its Past Crimes
Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- An international memorial service for holocaust victims was recently held in Poland on the occasion of the 66th anniversary of the liberation of O'swiecim Concentration Camp. This served as a reminder of the heinous murder and other war crimes committed by the warlike forces in the past. It reflected the mindset of the world people not to see such tragic history repeating itself. It also showed the urge of the times for the criminal states to repent of their past crimes and right their wrongs. 
					 It is exactly Japan which should accept this demand of the times, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday in a bylined commentary. 
					
					 The commentary goes on: 
					
					 The acknowledgment of the past crimes and compensation for them are the responsibility of Japan before history and its legal and moral duty. 
					
					 Other criminal countries are striving in every way to turn over a new leaf for peaceful development after breaking with their past.
					
					 Japan stands in sharp contrast to Germany in its attitude toward the past. If it is guilt-conscious even a bit and feels remorseful for its inglorious past, it should show the will to sincerely reflect and settle it. 
					
					 Wrongdoers should feel responsibility for their crimes and redeem them. This is the ethics and morality and international usage. It is only Japan in the world that is not willing to right its past wrongs. 
					
					 What is most resentful is that the Japanese reactionaries are stepping up the establishment of war system and the moves to be a military power spurred by sinister ambition to repeat the past history of aggression and war crimes. They are getting frantic in the war exercises while intensifying the moves for revival of militarism and arms buildup for aggression. They aim to realize their ambition for reinvasion without settling the past. 
					
					 All the soldiers and people of the DPRK with mounting anger at Japan, their sworn-enemy, are renewing their will to settle accounts with it. It had better come out for the earlier liquidation of the past, clearly understanding the feelings toward Japan and will of the army and people of the DPRK.

articles.title: Multipolarization Is World Trend--Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Multipolarization Is World Trend--Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- World is moving toward multipolarization against the imperialists' moves for a unipolar world. It is thanks to the peoples' efforts for independence, peace and progress. 
					 Rodong Sinmun says this in a bylined article Sunday.
					
					 Asia, Africa and Latin America have promoted regional integration and unification and the developing countries have closely cooperated in recent years, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 What is noteworthy in the current trend of the international situation is that military hegemonism grew weak after sustaining a great blow while the multipolarization is actively promoted in the field of security.
					
					 Countries in Asia, Africa, Latin America, Europe and other regions are taking joint action for regional unitary currency and market management against the U.S. dollar which is considered world key reserve currency.
					
					 There is also a move to organize an integrated body involving countries in Africa and South America with a view to strengthening the South-South cooperation.
					
					 The world trend for multipolarization clearly shows the development of the present history advancing towards the independence and peace against domination and subordination.
					
					 The efforts for the multipolar world will get intensified against the imperialists' moves to build a unipolar world.
					
					 No force on earth can stop this trend.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Theory of Seed in National Economy
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Theory of Seed in National Economy
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- It is necessary to make all the fields of the national economy Juche-oriented and modern and kindle a flame for boosted production as required by the IT era this year. A key to this is to discover correct seed and cultivate it.
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 The theory of seed set forth by the Workers' Party of Korea is an ideological theory calling for discovering correct seed essential for everything and giving precedence to it, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 This provides a guarantee for ensuring local supply of raw and other materials, fuel and power, equipping the national economy with ultra-modern technology and ensuring profitability from Juche-based and modern national economy.
					
					 The Korean people have achieved great success in guaranteeing the local supply of materials, true to the theory of seed. The completion of the Juche iron and fertilizer production systems is a fruition of the strenuous drive waged with non-coke and coal gasification as seeds.
					
					 Now many industrial enterprises have modernized machinery and production processes and kept production going at a high rate. It is possible to attain the high goal of increased production and modernization if one correctly embodies the theory of seed in unusual spirit of creation to advance toward the world. This is another precious mental treasure the Korean people gained in two years of great surge.
					
					 They will bring about a decisive turn in improving the people's standard of living and building a thriving nation by holding fast to this theory under the leadership of the great party this year.

articles.title: Stop to Projected Joint Military Exercises Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Stop to Projected Joint Military Exercises Demanded in S. Korea
Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- South Korean civic and public organizations held a press conference in Seoul on Feb. 16 demanding a halt to the projected Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises. They included the Solidarity for Progress, the Confederation of Trade Unions and the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification.
					 They denounced the warlike forces for planning military exercises.
					
					 The "government" is describing them as annual and defensive ones but the armed forces are formed for offensive battle and the content of the exercises for this year includes the expansion and escalation of the drill for coping with the "emergency situation" simulating the collapse of someone, in particular, the organizations said. This reveals the aggressive nature of the exercises, they added.
					
					 It is an act of chilling the atmosphere of dialogue for the warlike forces to mobilize even the offensive means including aircraft carrier defying the demand at home and abroad for improved south-north relations and peace on the Korean Peninsula, they held.
					
					 The representatives of civic and public organizations in Seoul held another press conference on Feb. 14. They declared that they would stage a demonstration outside the U.S. embassy demanding a stop to the joint military exercises and the unconditional resumption of the south-north dialogue.

articles.title: US Seeks Triangular Military Alliance
articles.content:
US Seeks Triangular Military Alliance
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- The United States, in its national military strategy for 2011, seeks a triangular military alliance involving Japan and south Korea.
					 The U.S. will maintain a strong military presence in northeast Asia for decades, the strategy report said.
					
					 "We will continue to work with Japan and south Korea to help improve security ties between them, enhance military cooperation and preserve regional stability", the report noted. "We will work with the Japan Self-Defense Forces to improve their out-of-area operational capabilities as the nation adjusts its defense posture. We will retain operational control over combined forces on the Korean peninsula through 2015 and provide assistance to south Korea as it expands its security responsibilities." 
					
					 The U.S. is prepared to commit the resources needed to oppose any nation's actions that threaten the security of its allies, the report added.
					
					In a nutshell, the latest strategy reveals the U.S. administration's intention to legalize the formation of the triangular military alliance and keep its military presence long in northeast Asia.

articles.title: Japan Should Admit Results of World War II--Russian FM
articles.content:
Japan Should Admit Results of World War II--Russian FM
 Moscow, February 20 (KCNA) -- Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov Tuesday demanded Japan admit the outcome of World War II.
					 Japan should do so if it wants to mediate the peace treaty issue, he urged.
					
					 There is no other way as long as it does not admit the war results unlike other countries, he added.

articles.title: China Strives to Create Sound Social Atmosphere
articles.content:
China Strives to Create Sound Social Atmosphere
 Beijing, February 20 (KCNA) -- China intensified the campaign against yellow culture and illegal publications in order to ensure a sound and stable social order during the lunar New Year celebration days.
					 The main purpose of the campaign is to prevent vulgar and erotic information from spreading through Internet and mobile phones and check infringement upon intellectual property rights and manufacture and selling of sham and low-quality goods.
					
					 The campaign is also aimed to create a harmonious cultured atmosphere in markets and help youngsters keep up sound physical and mental conditions through Internet and promote markets' development through production activities.

articles.title: China Ranks Fourth in IP Application
articles.content:
China Ranks Fourth in IP Application
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- The World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO) announced in Geneva on February 9 that China's international patent applications increased sharply last year, making the country the world's fourth IP applicant.
					 Statistics released by WIPO showed the IP applications made by China under the "Patent Cooperation Treaty" (PCT) increased from 7 900 in 2009 to 12 339 in 2010, a 56.2 percent jump.
					
					 Two Chinese businesses rank second and fourth in IP application in the world.
					
					 WIPO noted IP applications are on steady increase in northeast Asian nations.

articles.title: Police Crimes Increase in Japan
articles.content:
Police Crimes Increase in Japan
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Police officers and staff members submitted to disciplinary punishment in Japan last year total 385, or 60 percent higher than in the previous year.
					 Of them, 48 were dismissed, a record high since 2003. 70 were suspended from their duties and 136 degraded. 
					
					 76 of the disciplined stole lost things sent to police stands for giving back to their owners and 55 performed immoral sexual acts.
					
					 Many of them are middle-aged police officers.
					
					 The increasing police crimes provide a glimpse of Japanese society's true colors.
					
					Admittedly, the crime situation in Japan is very serious.
					
					 In 2009, about 1.7 million crimes, including robbery and rape, were recorded in the country, and 174 cases of drug smuggling detected at Narita Airport.
					
					 It is shameful for Japan, styling itself a law-governed state, that policemen perpetrate all sorts of wrongdoings, deviating from their duty to prevent crimes.

articles.title: World Foodstuff Prices Skyrocket
articles.content:
World Foodstuff Prices Skyrocket
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Prices of foodstuff are steadily rising worldwide, sparking serious concern.
					 As of Feb. 15 the international market price of wheat has gone up 20 percent while that of corn 12 percent as against the fourth quarter of last year, according to data available.
					
					 About 44 million world people are said to mire in dire poverty due to the sharp price hike.

articles.title: New Women's Organization Formed in United Nations
articles.content:
New Women's Organization Formed in United Nations
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- The United Nations has formed a new women's organization.
					 At the first meeting of its Executive Council, Secretary General Michelle Bachelet suggested a 100-day action program as an urgent item for cooperating with other UN organizations and increasing women coordinators at peace negotiations in disputed regions.
					
					 She also called on the international community to improve the women's status.
					
					 The new organization is a merger of four UN women's organizations. Its mission includes encouraging women to take part in social activities, putting an end to violence against women and enhancing women's role in dispute settlement.
					
					 China, Brazil, France and 38 other countries were elected members of the Executive Council in last November.

articles.title: Foreign Media Celebrates Kim Jong Il's Birthday
articles.content:
Foreign Media Celebrates Kim Jong Il's Birthday
Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Russian and Malaysian media contributed special write-ups to the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Russian newspaper Patriot No. 6 carried his portrait as well as his photo standing together with President Kim Il Sung when giving articles under various titles. His photos on revolutionary activities were also given in the paper.
					
					 An article titled "Successor to the Great Leader" said that the issue for carrying forward the revolutionary cause was successfully solved in the DPRK by Kim Jong Il, a man of pen and sword.
					
					 An article titled "The Songun Politics for Korea and the World" introduced the historical circumstances of the birth of the Songun politics. The Songun politics encourages the people in their efforts for independence and lasting peace and stability of the world. The human cause of independence will surely win victory, the article added.
					
					 Articles titled "Son of the People" and "Leader of Creation" elaborated on Kim Jong Il's noble view of the people and his Songun politics serving the people.
					
					 A TV broadcast of Khabarovsk Territory, Russia, released special reports several times on February 13 and 14. It showed Kim Jong Il acknowledging the cheering masses and giving field guidance to units of the People's Army and various fields of the national economy.
					
					 The February 12th issue of the Malaysian newspaper Guang Ming Daily carried an article titled "Leader Kim Jong Il and His Birthday" with his portrait. It praised the peerlessly great man who devotes even his birthday to the prosperity of the country and the happiness of the people.
					
					 The paper also carried photos of Kimjongilia and birthplace of Kim Jong Il in the Paektusan Secret Camp.

articles.title: Foreigners Praise Kim Jong Il's Exploits
articles.content:
Foreigners Praise Kim Jong Il's Exploits
Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in Democratic Congo, Bangladesh, Brazil and Mongolia on February 10 and 11 to mark the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Speakers included Rohekele Andre, president of the Working Citizens' Association who doubles as chairman of the Democratic Congolese preparatory committee for celebrating February 16, the birthday of Kim Jong Il, and Otete Gaston Mboyo, chairman of the Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association. They praised the exploits by Kim Jong Il before the times, the revolution, the country and the people.
					
					 Rashed Khan Menon, chairman of the Central Committee of the Workersâ€™ Party of Bangladesh, Hasanul Huq Inu, chairman of the Central Executive Committee of the Bangladesh National Socialist Party, Ragib Ahsan Munna, secretary general of the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee, and other speakers said that the DPRK took up the position of politico-ideological and military power, scientific and technical power and nuclear weapons state under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Jose Gil de Almeida, chairman of the Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK, noted that the DPRK would always demonstrate its might as a fortress of independence and peace as it is led by Kim Jong Il who is defending peace with Songun.
					
					 D. Bilegt, general secretary of the Federation of Peace and Friendship Organizations of Mongolia, said that under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il the Korean people have achieved great successes in building a thriving nation. He extended warm congratulations to the Korean people celebrating his birthday.
					
					 A message of greetings to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting held in Democratic Congo.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Germany
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Germany
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "On Establishing Socialist Cultured Practice in Life to Meet the Need of the Songun Era" was brought out in booklet on February 14 by the German Branch of the Korean Friendship Association.
					 The work was published on February 10 and July 2, Juche 92 (2003). It comprehensively indicates an importance of establishing cultured practice in life to meet the need of the Songun era and tasks and ways to do it.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised Abroad
						
Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Seminars were held in Britain, Russia, Finland and Nepal on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. They were held in the period between Feb. 10 and 12.
					 It is a great honor and pride of the Workers' Party of Korea and the people of the DPRK that they reelected Kim Jong Il as general secretary of the party, said Andy Brooks, general secretary of the Central Committee of the New Communist Party of Britain. This provided a fundamental guarantee for carrying forward the revolutionary cause of Juche, he added.
					
					 Under the leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il the DPRK has fulfilled its historic mission and role of leading the world progressive people in their efforts to build a new society under the complicated world situation at present, said Michael Chant, secretary general of the Coordinating Committee of the British Friends of the DPRK.
					
					 S. Z. Umalatova, chairwoman of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia, praised Kim Jong Il as a state leader possessed of perfect qualifications as a great man and genuine people's leader serving them with great loving care.
					
					 Hannu Harju, chairman of the Communist Workers' Party of Finland for the Peace and Socialism, said that the DPRK has turned into the genuine people's country and socialist political and military power in which the Juche idea has come true under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
